newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shanghai Ind to broaden investment base.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai Ind to broaden investment base.

text.p: Red chip conglomerate Shanghai Industrial Holdings Ltd will broaden its investment base with the aim of giving investors a better window into Shanghai's future economic growth, senior executives said on Thursday.

"Further investments in areas such as service industries and high tech manufacturing will enable us to realise a more perfect Shanghai (investment) concept," said president Chen Wei Shu at a press conference following the company's annual general meeting.
The company will continue to concentrate on its existing operations which include consumer goods manufacturing, retailing and wholesaling, auto parts manufacturing and infrastructural development.
Management also confirmed that Shanghai Industrial is acquiring a stake in the newest H share offer to come to the market, Zhejiang Expressway Co Ltd.

Shanghai Industrial will invest about HK$300 million, taking 10 percent of the new issue and giving it a three percent stake in the enlarged issued capital of the new H share company, chairman Cai Lai Xing said.
The offer price of shares of Zhejiang Expressway is expected to fall in a range of HK$2.06 tp HK$2.38, the company said.
The offer will close on Friday and dealing in the shares is expected to commence on May 15.

In April, Shanghai Industrial announced plans to buy a 35 percent stake in two toll roads in Shanghai for US$600 million. The investment, in Shanghai's Inner Rind Road and North-to-South Elevated Expressway, would give the company a holding in the entire elevated roadway system in Shanghai.

Separately, the company's parent company Shanghai Industrial Investment (Holdings) Co Ltd (SIIC) will take a stake in Beijing Enterprises Ltd, a company based in Hong Kong but backed by the Beijing municipal government.
Beijing Enterprises is forecast to be brought to the Hong Kong market later this month.
